events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on the evening of May 9th, resulting in front-end damage and minor injuries.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the description of the vehicle collision provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle all communications and gather more detailed information from the claimant.
Acknowledgment of claim receipt was sent to the customer with assurance that their case will be actively processed.
The claimant was asked to submit the police report, vehicle registration, and photos of the damage to the car for further investigation.
All requested documents including the police report and repair estimates were received from the claimant on May 12.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted documents and contacting involved parties to assess details of the accident.
The accident investigation was concluded confirming liability and verifying the extent of vehicle damage reported by the claimant.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering both vehicle repairs and medical expenses related to the car accident.
The claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely handling of their case.
The claim was officially approved following the claimant's acceptance of the settlement terms and validation of all required paperwork.
Payment covering the agreed settlement for vehicle repairs and related injuries was issued electronically to the claimant's designated account.
The insurance claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the claimant had no further concerns.
The claim file was archived successfully, ensuring all documentation and communications are securely stored for future reference.
